intro: Hieracium laurenii, commonly known as the Lauren's hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of central and eastern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Hieracium laurenii is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cool, moist environments.
